column5: hes in a better place chasing heaven squirrels
It is always a very tough decision to make but you made the right one. Sorry for your loss.
Sorry for your loss Brian but from one dog lover to another, be sure you did the right thing in relieving his discomfort. He is now at peace.You know inside you did the right thing.

Yesterday was a very sad day for everyone in our household. I mentioned a while back in another thread, that our poor old Pup was having a tough time getting around since Thanksgiving week-end. Things continued to decline and he was loosing more and more control over his hind legs. Well, things really progressed quickly for the worse over the past few days and yesterday, we had to face the inevitable. Ol' Tyler was unable to stand on his own and appeared to start having some pain. He would cry out from time to time and just laid there in the front hall.  We called the girls and they all came home to be there with him and us At 2:15 yesterday afternoon, he went to sleep for the final time The Veterinarian was excellent with us all, but nothing can make the pain we feel go away. We know we did the right thing for him and the look in his eyes almost appeared to be thanking us. He lived with so much dignity all his life and we could never have asked for a better dog. The way he was yesterday, was just not the way he deserved to live.  We all knew that this time was likely to come sooner than later, but nothing can prepare you for this. I know many of you have had to face this type of thing as well. Our world is so empty without him. .  Tyler (aka "Bubba") April 1998 - January 1, 2011 Never to be forgotten
I'm saddened to hear of this Brian, from one dog lover to another you have my sympathies.

Brian, Sorry to here about Bubba. I can only imagine what your family is going through. They are like children to us. Just like any other family member. I'm sure he will be sadly missed but when one door closes another opens.

Brian, i feel your pain and your loss. I have been there a number of times myself. But my love of dogs, and the unconditional love they show us, always makes me get another.Not to replace or fill the hole left when one departs, but to share my life with such a noble, loyal and loving creature.
Very sorry to hear the news, our Andy is 14 now and starting to have similar problems, I fear it won't be long.
Same here and well said.

I feel for your loss. We have a Retriever that was also born in April '98, and we've been experiencing mobility issues. I'm not looking forward to the day when I'm in your shoes. With this being my wifes 1st dog, she already knows she's going to be a mess for some time afterwards.
So sorry to hear. It pulls at the heart every time I read about the loss of our closest companions. I've had the sad duty a few times.
Very sorry for your loss.  This is the only reason I have not bought another dog since my divorce 20 years ago.  Too tough to lose another true friend like that on me.
Been there and it,s not an easy thing to do,but for the sake of bubba,it,s the best thing.  Sorry to hear of this news Brian.
Very sorry to hear, it tears your heart out.

Really sorry to hear the news Brian, it's one of the toughest things a person ever goes thru & you've sure got my sympathies.  My little buddy Marvin turned 14 last October and it's something I think about every day.

Sad to hear it Brian, I had to put my dog Shadow down a couple of months ago. He looked just like yours, except more white hair than me. Strokes finally caught up with him, he was 16. All my kids grew up with him, it made for a tough day.

Sorry to hear that Brian.  Tyler looked like a beautiful, loving family member and I feel for you.  I have an aging cat that I love to death and we had a close call in Septmeber, but he pulled through.  I know his days are numbered and whenever he starts to act funny, I wonder if it is time.  Really sorry again Brian, I feel your pain.  Joey

It's always one of the hardest decisions to make, but ya made the right one for him. It will be three years next month since we had put our girl down (at too early of an age), and I still miss her to this day.  I know how you're feeling bud.
Sorry to hear about your loss Brian!....My wife and I are dog lovers too and know exactly what you and your family are going through as we've lost 3 of our boys over the years...
Sorry for your loss Rattletrap, a sad day indeed.  Cheers and all the best for 2011,  Shaun

I am so sorry for your loss. I cannot imagine the pain you must be going through at this time. As you said though, Tyler is in a better place and is not suffering. We build close bonds with our furry friends and parting is so difficult. I just got my new little guy (Toby) and have an 11 year old dog as well. As much as we know that they don't live forever, we can never be prepared for the inevitable.  My heart felt sympathies go out to you and your family.
It is always one of the most heart wrenching decisions for us, but the kindest and most thoughtful way to say goodbye. Lost my beloved Benson a year ago now, still think about him every day.
Really sorry to hear that ... I don't look forward to that kind of decision either.
Sorry for your loss. It kills me when I see these posts.....my dog is only a year out and I cant imagine.
Thanks everyone. I really think a love of the outdoors is the common bond that brings us all together. As much as we love being outdoors, we love the animals that share it with us just as well.
sorry for your loss i lost one in nov i know how you feel

I am sorry to hear about the loss of your companion Brian I know how you feel we lost our little guy after 14 years last Spring,he took his last breath in my arms and that was a tough deal for sure. You have Sue and my condolences.

I know it is difficult to say goodbye to a pet you held so dear Brian...  I hope and pray you find comfort and peace in the fond memories you made together ...  Their footprints will always be on our hearts...
